results.title: Burra, South Australia
results.brief_description: A film on the copper mining carried out at Burra in the early 1800’s. Historic buildings are shown, as are pump houses and ventilation chimneys built on the copper fields by the Cornish and Welshmen. Photography by Ron Horner.

results.title: Burnt by the sun = Utomlynonnye solntsem
results.creator_credit: Studio Trite, Camera One, Canal+ and Nikita Mikhalkov
results.brief_description: Set in the Russian summer of 1936, “Burnt By the Sun” is a splendid film about the human damage wreaked by the Stalinist purges, and the betrayal of the revolutionary hopes of the Soviet people. Colonel Serguei Kotov is a military hero of the Bolshevik Revolution who is surrounded by loving family and comrades. In this ideal existence arrives a stranger, Dimitri, who represents the cold, indifferent face of Stalin’s terror. Slowly Kotov realises he is enmeshed in a senseless and violent maze from which there is no escape. Beautifully shot and executed, “Burnt By the Sun” is a study in the creeping paranoia and madness of a regime which has lost sight of its roots and lost sight of humanity. By encapsulating the drama of betrayal, corruption and totalitarianism in the personal struggle of Kotov to make sense of what it happening to himself and his family, this film offers both a powerful examination of the Stalinist era as well as acknowledging the impossibility of any one film, any one document being able to fully represent the horror of a period in which millions lost their lives, their dreams and their sanity. Academy Award winner for Best Foreign Language Film. In Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: Burns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Causes and types of burns. Emergency treatment required. Looks closely at the treatment of a burnt leg and examines the situation of burns around the head and neck area which may have a serious effect on the patient’s ability to breathe. Treatment of the patient’s emotional state.

results.title: Burns
results.brief_description: This occupational health and safety video is suitable for anyone needing to learn about the crucial stage of first aid in burns treatment. It demonstrates how if burns are treated straight after they happen, it can mean the difference between life and death.

results.title: Burnout
results.creator_credit: M T I Teleprograms, John McDonald and J. Gary Mitchell
results.brief_description: A series of dramatized sequences illustrate different types of ‘burnout’ that occur in work situations. Shows the frustrations which create it, varying responses and shows how communication combats burnout. Includes cameos from actor Pee Wee Herman as a therapist, pop star and french film actor.

results.title: Burn, bury or what?
results.brief_description: Describes how the District of Columbia solved its problem of solid waste disposal by developing a technically sound long-range plan. Illustrates how other cities can solve solid waste disposal problems by using sanitary landfill, accomplished through the use of the latest engineering techniques.

results.title: Burn emergency
results.creator_credit: Renan Productions, Pyramid Films, Sheldon Renan and Rick Wise
results.brief_description: Shows the most current methods of caring for burn victims, including thermal, inhalation, electrical and chemical burns, until they can reach a hospital. Demonstrates how to estimate the extent of burn damage and how to take an accident and medical history quickly to facilitate later treatment. Suitable for upper primary and secondary school levels.

results.title: Burn care: a life at stake
results.creator_credit: John Ralmon and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Aimed at teaching first aid for burns. Shows how to assess the extent and degree of burns, and how to treat thermal, electrical and chemical burns before medical aid is administered. Includes interviews with burn victims, medical photographs illustrating various kinds of burns and realistic dramatisations of burn accidents.

results.title: Burma: people of the river
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The varied regions and ways of living in Burma - the rivers that serve as highways; the rice fields in the delta and river valleys; jungle that yields harvests of teakwood and bamboo; the village life; and the city of Rangoon, centre of commerce, transportation and ancient culture.

results.title: Burma victory
results.creator_credit: David Macdonald, Army Film Unit and Roy Boulting
results.brief_description: Compilation of footage covering the Burma campaign against the Japanese between 1942 and 1945. For censorship reasons this campaign was given very little newsreel coverage and the footage was assembled into an absorbing narrative. Footage taken by British, Indian and American Combat Cameramen of South-East Asia Command.
